text.tspan: 1. I know what I should do, but I'm gonna do something else

flowRoot.flowPara: One of the primary tasks in academia is writing papers, and a large chunk of doing that for me was the dreaded literature study.There is a whole other post about how the "papers written" metric seems like the wrong one for academia to be judging grants on, but thats where we are.The literature study for me came in two halves.There were a few key papers that I based my experiments/studies on, and then another tranche of work after the paper had been written, just to fill up the references section.While this particular task was largely for the wrong reason, it was still extremely interesting to poke around and see what other people had done, and when. In academia of course most of the really interesting stuff was locked away behind a pay wall.The internet has done wonders for opinions, since everyone (including fools like me), can write and publish.Not every piece is going to be scientifically sound or as rigourously peer reviewed (even the worst code review you've ever had isn't as harsh as some of the rejections you get from publications â€“ true or wishful??), but as a source of inspiration, it's unparalled.Since everything is public, this means that the numbers of people echoing back is vast and, on average, good people rise to the top. I don't call this echo process peer review, because you don't know the bonefides of your repeaters, but its a good bet that if everyone I talking about someone in connection with a topic, it might be worth listening to them, just to see if you agree.Critically this means there is no excuse not to know who is making interesting contributions and saying useful things, and cultivating your own "I listen when they speak" / interesting / inspiring people list.Ultimately the value of any such list is purely in your eyes,Who are my list of interesting people?John D Cook Tim Bray Michael Lopp (aka rands) adrianco Elon Musk Marissa Mayer Patrick KuaIt's way past time you had a list.

text.tspan: Sometimes I have my own ideas. [blog]
I am more than just my job title. [soundcloud]
